profile_positions.description:
- Design, implementation and optimization of processes and equipment to produce natural gas efficiently and safely. 
- Monitoring and controlling production processes to ensure they meet performance and quality standards. 
- Conducting process simulations and modeling to evaluate new designs and techniques
- Troubleshooting and resolving production issues and equipment malfunctions
- Managing and training production staff

Bidding projects
- Introduction of the LNG technology to Colombia.
- Exploitation of natural gas for power generation in the Colombian gas field Palagua.
profile_positions.title: Research, Development and Process Engineer

profile_positions.description:
- Design and assembly of a pilot plant extractive dividing wall column (E-DWC) with internal sequential heat exchangers to produce fuel grade ethanol. 

This project was carried out in the frame project titled "Columnas no convencionales para mejorar la eficiencia energética de columnas de destilación" (Non-conventional columns to improve energy efficiency in distillation processes) in the framework of "COLCIENCIAS convocatoria 700-2014" by "Resolución UNAL 3676".

company.name: Process Dynamics and Operations Group (dbta) | Technische Universität Berlin
company.description:
We are a research group at Faculty III (Process Sciences) at TU Berlin. In Faculty III, we belong to the Institute of Process Engineering. 

Our research group was founded in 1993 by Prof. G. Wozny. In 2015, Prof. Wozny was succeeded by Prof. J.-U. Repke. 

The research at our group is performed in 4 research clusters: Intensified Process (IP), Model Development (MD), Methods for Process Design and Operation (MPDO), and Transport Phenomena (TP). For more details on our research, our courses for students, and our team, please visit our website.
